page.title: 03IRLAM LOCKS
page.content: Irlam locks are on the Manchester Ship Canal. They were dug by navvies, which is short for navigators. These were mostly Irish immigrants and used picks and shovels, not the JCB construction tools we use today. When you walk past the canal it smells of dirty sewage. You often see things floating and the odd Tesco trolley in the mud. In one corner of the locks is all the floating rubbish that people have thrown in and boats that are moored and never move. Water from the waterfall splashes on you when you cross the bridge. Sometimes if my mum is going to Quicksave, which is over the other side in Irlam, I go with her. At night it is calm and peaceful and you see old people walking their dogs.
